question: Does activation of murine caspase-11 promote pyroptosis in macrophages? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: We also determined that active mouse caspase-11 was required for restriction of L. pneumophila infection.
content.source_2: In infected macrophages, caspase-11 activation did not promote pyroptosis; it was dispensable for pore formation and failed to increase gasdermin D cleavage or LDH release after challenge with Legionella, Salmonella, Francisella, and Listeria.
content.source_3: Although dispensable for caspase-1 activation, active caspase-11 independently drove noncanonical pyroptosis in macrophages exposed to Legionella, Salmonella, Francisella, and Listeria.
content.source_4: Activation of mouse caspase-11 primarily enhanced phagosome–lysosome fusion and actin remodeling without inducing pyroptotic death, as lytic cell loss and IL-1β release were unchanged relative to Casp11−/− controls during L. pneumophila infection.
